intro: Aspidosperma discolor var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved yellowwood, is a deciduous tree native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by orange-red berries. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
